Definition.Description: By periodically shutting down to ensure all equipment is operating as best possible, the production unit was able to fulfill the order 10.5 days sooner (an 11% improvement on their typical fulfillment time) . In a high demand environment, this operational change has the ability to increase sales volumes
Definition.Document:
Run Length Optimization

 

Problem Statement

Many manufacturing units hit process throughput constraints over the course of a run. These constraints are often reversible, but at the cost of shutting down to clean/maintain equipment.  

Assuming every production time period has associated downtime, predicting the right time to shutdown and clean equipment enables a unit to meet their production goals sooner. Meeting targets sooner translates into more production (& $$) over time. 

Optimizing run length to meet production target sooner

Solution:

Predict future production rate and identify when the production target of 50,000 klb is met if no downtime is scheduled during the run.

Calculate the number of downtimes that would be required to fulfill the order quantity at any point in the production cycle. 

Calculate the Average Production Rate at each point during the current run time and the total run time (including downtimes) required to produce the given order quantity based on the number of required downtimes.

Find the minimum run length required to show the full order fulfillment time. 

Find the production rate at the point of minimum run length to trigger proactive downtime.

Build a Reference Profile for the ideal production cycles to monitor current operations against.

Quantify the potential time savings and monitor results.

Run Length Optimization

 

Problem Statement

Many manufacturing units hit process throughput constraints over the course of a run. These constraints are often reversible, but at the cost of shutting down to clean/maintain equipment.  

Assuming every production time period has associated downtime, predicting the right time to shutdown and clean equipment enables a unit to meet their production goals sooner. Meeting targets sooner translates into more production (& $$) over time. 

Optimizing run length to meet production target sooner

Solution:

Predict future production rate and identify when the production target of 50,000 klb is met if no downtime is scheduled during the run.

Calculate the number of downtimes that would be required to fulfill the order quantity at any point in the production cycle. 

Calculate the Average Production Rate at each point during the current run time and the total run time (including downtimes) required to produce the given order quantity based on the number of required downtimes.

Find the minimum run length required and use that to create a new condition showing the full order fulfillment time. 

Find the production rate at the point of minimum run length to trigger proactive downtime.

Build a Reference Profile for the ideal production cycles to monitor current operations against.

Definition.Name: Run Length Optimization
Definition.Plain Text Document: Run Length Optimization By periodically shutting down to ensure all equipment is operating as best possible, the production unit was able to fulfill the order 10.5 days sooner (an 11% improvement on their typical fulfillment time). In a high demand environment, this operational change has the ability to increase sales volumes and revenues by an equal percentage. Problem StatementMany manufacturing units hit process throughput constraints over the course of a run. These constraints are often reversible, but at the cost of shutting down to clean/maintain equipment.  Assuming every production time period has associated downtime, predicting the right time to shutdown and clean equipment enables a unit to meet their production goals sooner. Meeting targets sooner translates into more production (& $$) over time. Optimizing run length to meet production target soonerSolution:Predict future production rate and identify when the production target of 50,000 klb is met if no downtime is scheduled during the run.Calculate the number of downtimes that would be required to fulfill the order quantity at any point in the production cycle. Calculate the Average Production Rate at each point during the current run time and the total run time (including downtimes) required to produce the given order quantity based on the number of required downtimes.Find the minimum run length required to show the full order fulfillment time. Find the production rate at the point of minimum run length to trigger proactive downtime.Build a Reference Profile for the ideal production cycles to monitor current operations against.Quantify the potential time savings and monitor results.
